author: CaeliaShortface
body:
you may be onto something with MCHP. 

On top of the debt, their customers are heavy manufacturing (automotive being the largest). Their solutions go in the plants and nobody is doing heavy manufacturing right now. 

&#x200B;

[https://www.microchip.com/design-centers/automotive-solutions](https://www.microchip.com/design-centers/automotive-solutions)

author: theoldandtheresting
body: MCHP Puts 4/17 for now, I'll roll out until mid June on these starting Monday since it doesn't look like they should make it past that.

author: Grizzant
body: microchip produces a good product. they are diversified across several major sectors. is your entire premise built on the fact they have debt they have to service?

author: theoldandtheresting
body:
MCHP June 1 is there first next big payment. They should have $800M in the bank with the revolver and what little was left from employee shares. Next payment should be $230M June 1. With being unable to collect on the A/R, it will probably look like a better option to get the ball rolling on selling off pieces or outright bking seeing the future outlook. They cannot outpace their debt. Revolver due 3/21/21 and that first note of 1B due 6/1/21. 

It might not hit by Jun 15 strike, but it will be damn close.
